title: SpaceX to make a second attempt to launch its massive Starship rocket
summary: The most likely outcome is that something goes wrong during this flight.

title: With a new medium rocket, Firefly plans to compete for national security launches
summary: Firefly Aerospace says its future medium rocket it is developing with Northrop Grumman will be ready to compete in the next round of U.S. national security launch contracts.

title: Starship set for maiden launch attempt Thursday
summary: The most powerful rocket in history is making its second attempt to launch on Thursday, the first major step to making life multi-planetary. Liftoff of Starship from Starbase, Texas is now set to occur in a shorter 62-minute window that opens at 8:28 AM Central (13:28 UTC).

title: NASA Creates In-Space Servicing, Assembly, Manufacturing Consortium
summary: NASA announced Wednesday a new consortium focused on making in-space servicing, assembly, and manufacturing (ISAM) capabilities a routine part of space architectures and mission lifecycles.

title: Space investors see a return in industry growth capital
summary: Investment activity is picking up again for young space companies as growth-stage capital returns following market uncertainty in 2022, according to investors on an April 18 Space Symposium panel.
